intro: Hiraea violacea var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy hiraea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
